SEARCH
Package farm.inventory.product

Class Product

Object
Product
Direct Known Subclasses:
Egg, Jam, Milk, Wool
public abstract class Product extends Object
An abstract class representing an instance of a product.

Each product is a single instance of a specific item.

Note: You are to decide if each method in Product should be abstract or concrete. It is open for to decide your implementation.

Component of Stage 1.

  • Method Details

    • getBarcode

      public Barcode getBarcode()
      Accessor method for the product's identifier.
      Returns:
      the identifying Barcode for this product.

    • getDisplayName

      public String getDisplayName()
      Retrieve the product's display name, for visual/textual representation.
      Returns:
      the product's display name.

    • getQuality

      public Quality getQuality()
      Retrieve the product's quality.
      Returns:
      the quality level for this product.

    • getBasePrice

      public int getBasePrice()
      Retrieve the products base sale price.
      Returns:
      the price of the product. In cents.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this product class. The representation contains the display name of the product, followed by its base price and quality. It is in the form <name>:<price>c *<quality>*

      Example output:
      Note: This example product is not a real product and is instead just used to demonstrate the format. 

      "bread: 240c *IRIDIUM*"
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The formatted string representation of the product.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      If two instances of product are equal to each other. Equality is defined by having the same barcode, base price, and quality.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if the other object is a product with the same barcode base price, and quality as the current product.

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      A hashcode method that respects the equals(Object) method.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      An appropriate hashcode value for this instance.
